name: NPR
text:
Brian McConnell found his "calling" in 2005: working with the Delta Honor Guard to greet the remains of military service members killed in active duty. @StoryCorps
https://t.co/SHmdTDUqJ1

name: NPR
text: John Bolton, President Trump's national security adviser from 2018 to 2019, does not believe the United States is safer today than it was four years ago. https://t.co/qE8FTh4AYx

name: NPR
text: Bolton says Trump's "ad hoc, almost random decision-making ... produces decisions that I do agree with from time to time, but it does not produce a coherent, effective, sustained policy, which is what you need to be successful in national security." https://t.co/eqDmhKQeiC

name: NPR
text:
As a prosecutor, Kamala Harris pushed for a program intended to reduce school absences. Here's how it ended up producing unintended consequences ‚Äî for California families and Harris herself. 
https://t.co/8oEOJEJTr8

name: NPR
text: Researchers lost track of an Asian giant hornet, AKA "murder hornet," ‚Äî a stinging setback in the race to eradicate an invasive species that threatens bee populations. https://t.co/4pofuBBH9n

name: NPR
text: An oil and gas company said it would pay for a new school if it built a petrochemical plant in this Appalachian town. But the pandemic ‚Äî and an oversupply of plastics ‚Äî has left the project's fate up in the air. https://t.co/tPDJgdb4dI

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: When her breast cancer diagnosis came, she yearned for human contact.

"So please, mask up," she writes. "Do your part so that we will be able to reach the point where we can again get that human bond that makes patients stronger."
https://t.co/TkDj4BzCJy

name: NPR
text:
Suffragists, witching, folklore, flawed alliances, an alternate America: If spells are truly hidden in stories, our reviewer says Alix Harrow's new book contains one to claim a heart and dwell there, ever after.
https://t.co/yIl2LOfFhj

name: NPR
text:
Pre-Columbian indigenous cultures influenced the world in Rebecca Roanhorse's new fantasy novel. "I have been reading epic fantasies inspired by European settings since I was a child," she says.

"I longed to see something different. So I wrote it."
https://t.co/H0iJMGI95S

name: NPR
text:
RT @nprpolitics: Early voting turnout continues to shatter records, as sky-high voter enthusiasm meets the realities of the U.S.' creaky machinery of democracy amid a pandemic.

Here are four takeaways so far: https://t.co/sI6LK0Re1d

name: NPR
text:
Lindsey Graham has won easily every time since he was first elected in 2002. But he's always relied on moderate voters ‚Äî who aren't happy with how close he's grown to Trump.

Now, he's in an unexpectedly tight race against Democrat Jaime Harrison. https://t.co/5V6wbX4J97

name: NPR
text: RT @LouderThanARiot: #LouderThanARiot üìí Liner Notes is back breaking down our second episode - The Camouflage Assassin: Mac Phipps (Pt 1). Let‚Äôs go.

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Michigan's governor, who the FBI says was targeted by a foiled kidnapping plot, accused the president of fanning the flames of domestic terrorism when he didn't put a stop to chants of "lock her up!" that erupted during a rally in her home state: https://t.co/JWod2R7hur

name: NPR
text:
In 2018, Missouri voters approved a state-level redistricting plan for an appointed demographer to create maps emphasizing competitiveness and partisan fairness.

But a new ballot measure added by the GOP-controlled state legislature aims to undo it. 
 
 https://t.co/F2g46vw0Yh

name: NPR
text:
Gov. Gretchen Whitmer: "It's incredibly disturbing that the president of the United States, 10 days after a plot to kidnap, put me on trial, and execute me ... is at it again and inspiring and incentivizing and inciting this kind of domestic terrorism."
https://t.co/dYWTcASiS9

name: NPR
text:
Wildfires and floods threaten tens of millions of properties in the U.S. ‚Äî numbers that will likely grow as climate change leads to more frequent and severe disasters.

Yet most Americans don't learn their home is at risk until it's too late. https://t.co/4QOZe5QFMQ

name: NPR
text:
So what can you do?

Homeowners can do a lot to improve the chances that a building will survive a wildfire. The key is knowing your risk and keeping up with annual maintenance.

Here are six questions to ask to determine your risk: https://t.co/MnnSrCEXU9

name: NPR
text:
What about the most deadly and expensive natural disasters in the U.S. ‚Äî floods?

21 states don't require any flooding information to be disclosed to home buyers. Most tenants get no information at all.

Here's what to ask about flood risk before you move: https://t.co/L4KZ84qAVS

name: NPR
text:
What about floods, the most deadly and expensive natural disasters in the U.S.? 

21 states don't require any flooding information to be disclosed to home buyers. Most tenants get no information at all.

Here's what to ask about flood risk before you move: https://t.co/4jkWrKmYKC

name: NPR
text:
Floods are the most deadly and expensive natural disaster in the U.S. Yet 21 states don't require any flooding information be disclosed to home buyers ‚Äî and the majority of tenants receive none at all.

Here's what to ask about flood risk before you move:
https://t.co/GQEZrS9ENE

name: NPR
text:
A doctor saw an overlap between people using ERs for health care and those who aren't registered to vote. So he founded VotER:

Health workers wear a badge with a QR code. Scanning it takes patients to a site about registering.

Over 300 hospitals use it. https://t.co/sm4t0Ebp5j

name: NPR
text: RT @nprpolitics: Joe Biden's campaign is urging its supporters not to become complacent in the final weeks of the race, even as polling suggests he remains ahead of President Trump: https://t.co/qjmnqvgPAF

name: NPR
text: RT @LouderThanARiot: We‚Äôre back! In this installment of #LouderThanARiot Liner Notes üìí we break down our third episode - Lyrics On Trial: Mac Phipps (Pt 2). (THREAD)We‚Äôre back! In this installment of #LouderThanARiot Liner Notes üìí we break down our third episode - Lyrics On Trial‚Ä¶ https://t.co/1ulrLefj8h

name: NPR
text:
Joe Biden's campaign manager: "If we learned anything from 2016, it's that we cannot underestimate Donald Trump or his ability to claw his way back into contention in the final days of a campaign."
https://t.co/CRXYYXpnim

name: NPR
text:
For Pastor Antoinette Alvarado, voting is a family tradition. She and her family waited in line for 4.5 hours to vote. 

"It's very important to me as a pastor, a community leader and as a woman of color to have my voice heard.‚Äù @hereandnow
 https://t.co/jAYgEddeYW

name: NPR
text:
Name a world capital. Change one letter in it to D-Y. The result will be 2 words, one after the other. The first word names somebody you like to be around. The second word names somebody you don't like to be around. 

What city is it? https://t.co/hChzJMRDye
